text: when I copy a module path from my design manager. and call it in the react template it works. but when I create e module in react and call it here it doesn't work. Can anyone help me to solve this. I am a beginner

Hey <@UGDF9EBPW>,

Is dit al voldoende om het te vragen?
<@U0802PZFFEK> I think our aproach with hublData is better in this case, we should try to see if we can get an answer regarding the template field of the hero

Hello everyone. Our team is trying to put a theme on the marketplace, but there is an error in the source code, the community manager suggested that the error causes the Google console to loop and seems to be related to "Module compatibility with themes". But how can I specifically find out the location and type of the error so that I can fix it? Validation does not end and it is impossible to see the error. I used cms-react, maybe I wrote in the wrong thread, I apologize in advance

Hello <@U08CLL9H5U4> :wave-yeti:

A couple questions:
• When you say it isn't working, what are you seeing?
• It looks like you are providing the `module` tag a relative path to your React Module, can you confirm that the relative path is correct?  
• Have you built/deployed your React module?
Hi guys, Im facing this same issue, works perfectly on preview mode on my portal but on the published page the error its the mentioned above, any solution? what i’m missing?
Hey <@U083Z05GQSJ>, there is currently no support for CMS React in the marketplace which seems to align with the error message about "module compat" that you are seeing.
Hi <@U02G7H60YCS> thank you. It's sad, but is there an approximate time frame for when this will be supported?
Agreed and this is definitely on our radar but no approximate timeframe right now.
I don’t think you need to specify the index file. Just the module directory itself.
I would also love to sign up for this beta or do we have a idea on when it's going to be ready?
